titleStmt.title: E. Low et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5239

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To His Excellency Gov Thos E Bramlette

Your Petitioners represent that James B Chinn was fined for the offense of unlawfuly discharging a pistol in the corporate limits of Harrodsburg, said judgment being rendered in the Police Court of said Town, It was proven on the trial by witnesses that they beleived the firing to have been accidental & not wantonly or maliciously done- Said Chinn is a poor mechanic, moral & industrious, recently married & needs all the proceeds of his labour for the support of his family-

We beleive that your clemency could be judiciously exercised in this case & therefore humbly pray for a remission of this said fine
E. Low. M. T. H
J K Wilson
S S M Fatridge
F W Curry
A. F. Cochran
A James
Wm Hutchison
J H Bryant
G. W. Bohon
McGowan
Thos Edwards P J M C C
H. H. Curry
P F Patterson
W. Carter
N. N. Farnsworth
J. A. Tomlinson
Jno J Curd
Richard Board C. M. C. C
Thos D Bunford
W D James Depty Shirff
A. C. Passmore
E H Burford
H Hicks
R. B. Gibbs

Harrodsburg
Police Ct
vs
Jas B Chinn
refused
